title: Basque Black beans with Sweet potato & Mushrooms
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat ghee in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook black beans 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry mushrooms and kale with italian herbs 8 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook sweet potato until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Peas & Onion Pitta with Black beans
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook black beans 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peas and onion with thai green curry paste 14 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Halloumi Italian herbs bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat tahini in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook halloumi 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peppers and aubergine with italian herbs 6 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Turkey breast and Mushrooms Grill
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat walnuts in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook turkey breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry mushrooms and carrots with lemon & herb 9 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Turkey for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Indian Black beans with Jasmine rice & Green beans
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat almonds in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook black beans 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry green beans and courgette with italian herbs 17 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the jasmine rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Prawns Ras el hanout plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 170°C.
Toss garlic and courgette with half the olive oil, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season prawns and place on the tray. Roast for 54 min, turning once.
Cook the bulgur wheat according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Bulgur wheat or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tuna (canned) and Broccoli No-Cook
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix tuna (canned) with thai green curry paste and a pinch of salt.
Layer with broccoli, mushrooms and quinoa.
Cook the quinoa according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Tuna for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Quinoa or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
